meanings.def: to stop; to make somebody/something stop
examples: She walked towards him and then halted.
‘Halt!’ the Major ordered (= used as a command to soldiers).
halt somebody/something The police were halting traffic on the parade route.
The trial was halted after the first week.
A sudden shout made them halt in their tracks and look around.
All these ideas for expansion were abruptly halted by the outbreak of war.
The strike effectively halted production at the factory.
We are failing to halt the destruction of the rainforest.
She criticized his failure to halt the slide in the government's unpopularity.

meanings.def: to suddenly make somebody stop by frightening or surprising them; to suddenly stop because something has frightened or surprised you
examples: The question stopped Alice in her tracks.
Suddenly he stopped dead in his tracks: what was he doing?
(figurative) The disease was stopped in its tracks by immunization programmes.

idioms.idiom: stop/halt somebody in their tracks | stop/halt/freeze in your tracks
idioms.def: to suddenly make somebody stop by frightening or surprising them; to suddenly stop because something has frightened or surprised you
examples: The question stopped Alice in her tracks.
Suddenly he stopped dead in his tracks: what was he doing?
(figurative) The disease was stopped in its tracks by immunization programmes.

related: bring something to a grinding halt

meanings.def: an act of stopping the movement or progress of somebody/something
examples: Work came to a halt when the machine broke down.
The thought brought her to an abrupt halt.
The car skidded to a halt.
Strikes have led to a halt in production.
They decided it was time to call a halt to the project (= stop it officially).
The protesters are calling for a halt to the export of live animals.
They have ordered a halt to local elections.

meanings.def: a small train station in the country that has a platform but no buildings
to make something gradually go slower until it stops completely
examples: Roadworks brought traffic to a grinding halt.

meanings.def: to go slower gradually and then stop completely
examples: Production ground to a halt during the strike.
Her career ground to a halt when the twins were born.

idioms.idiom: bring something to a grinding halt
idioms.def: to make something gradually go slower until it stops completely
examples: Roadworks brought traffic to a grinding halt.

idioms.idiom: grind to a halt | come to a grinding halt
idioms.def: to go slower gradually and then stop completely
examples: Production ground to a halt during the strike.
Her career ground to a halt when the twins were born.
